title: PATOG Book
text:
1 Welcome to PATOG Book
This book is a Quarto-based online HTML book for the PATOG project.

title: PATOG Book
text:
1.1 Overview
PATOG (پاتوق) is a curated collection of resources around Bioinformatics, Data Science, ML, etc. The term “Patog” (more precisely, “Patogh”) is a Persian word that means “gathering place” or “social hangout”. PATOG is a central gathering place where individuals interested in bioinformatics, computational biology, data science, machine learning, and related fields can find valuable information and stay current with the latest advancements.

title: 2  Single-Cell Analysis
text:
2.1 What is Single-Cell Analysis?
Welcome to the Single-Cell Analysis chapter of the PATOG Book.
Single-cell analysis is a powerful approach in genomics that allows researchers to study individual cells, revealing cellular heterogeneity and providing insights into cell types, states, and interactions that would be masked in bulk analysis.

title: 2  Single-Cell Analysis
text:
2.2 Key Topics

Single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq)
Single-cell ATAC sequencing (scATAC-seq)
Single-cell proteomics
Spatial transcriptomics
Cell type identification
Trajectory analysis
Cell-cell communication
Integration of multi-omics data

title: 4  Git Fundamentals
text:
4.1 Introduction to Git
Git is a distributed version control system that helps track changes in source code during software development. It’s designed for coordinating work among programmers, but it can be used to track changes in any set of files.

title: 4  Git Fundamentals
text:
4.2 Core Concepts

Repository
Commit
Branch
Merge
Remote

title: 4  Git Fundamentals
text:
4.3 Basic Git Commands
# Initialize a new repository
git init

# Clone a repository
git clone <repository-url>

# Check status
git status

# Add files to staging
git add <file>
git add .

# Commit changes
git commit -m "commit message"

# Create and switch to a new branch
git checkout -b <branch-name>

# Switch branches
git checkout <branch-name>

# Merge branches
git merge <branch-name>

title: 4  Git Fundamentals
text:
4.4 Best Practices

Write clear commit messages
Create feature branches for new work
Keep commits atomic and focused
Regularly pull from remote
Review changes before committing

title: 5  GitHub Platform
text:
5.1 Introduction to GitHub
GitHub is a web-based platform that provides hosting for software development and version control using Git. It offers the distributed version control and source code management functionality of Git, plus its own features.

title: 5  GitHub Platform
text:
5.2 Key Features

Repository hosting
Issue tracking
Pull requests
Code review
Project management
GitHub Actions
GitHub Pages
GitHub Codespaces

title: 5  GitHub Platform

Use meaningful repository names
Write clear README files
Follow branching strategies
Use templates for issues and PRs

Regular maintenance and updates
